intro: Pseudocystopteris spinulosa var. taipaishanensis, commonly known as the Taipai Shan spleenwort, is a rare fern species native to China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds with a distinctive veining pattern. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rocky crevices or forest floors. Its spores are released from specialized structures called sorus, which are located on the underside of the fronds. This variety is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
